 money buys anything. Why do you think Congress is so reluctant to pass ethics bills? The Democrats continue to say it's only Republicans and Republicans claim it's mostly Democrats, that this was just one isolated incident (the Abermoff stuff). Sorry, I would be surprised if 99% of Congress had received some sort of bribe, and that's just the illegal stuff. If you include legal lobbying, you have entire industries buying the government. Why do you think smoking is legal yet drugs are not? Tabacco has a bigger lobby than marijuana does. Hell if the porn industry had a big enough lobby I'm sure Congress would find away not only to legalize it but to include it in school textbooks. Of course this takes money, and it seems most politicians have no problem sacrificing this country for some money in their pockets. How do you think they got elected? Seems money buys elections too. Why do you think no third party candidates get elected?

 Who was talking about Clinton's "youth". emoticon_confused 
 
 

 Dr. Sam Houston, a respected Little Rock physician and once a doctor for Hillary's cantankerous father, Hugh Rodham, says it is well known in Little Rock medical circles that Clinton was brought to a Little Rock hospital for emergency treatment for an apparent cocaine overdose.
 
 According to Houston, who told us he spoke to someone intimately familiar with the details of what happened that night, Clinton arrived at the hospital with the aid of a state trooper. Hillary Clinton had been notified by phone and had instructed the hospital staff that Clinton's personal physician would be arriving soon.
 
 When Mrs. Clinton arrived, she told both of the resident physicians on duty that night that they would never again practice medicine in the United States if word leaked out about Clinton's drug problem. Reportedly, she pinned one of the doctors up against the wall, both hands pressed against his shoulders, as she gave her dire warning.
 
 Like most tales that reflect poorly on Bill Clinton, the press has ignored any inquiry into this one. In 1996, however, columnist R. Emmett Tyrrell located and telephoned one of the nurses who had been on duty the night Bill Clinton was brought into the emergency room. According to Tyrrell, the nurse didn't deny the story, but said she couldn't talk about it because she could lose her job. Welcome to Arkansas.

It's been said that JFK would not have the status he has as a past president if he had not been assasinated. I think this is probably true. There are other presidents that did more than Kennedy in terms of accomplishments who seem to have less status. Kennedy had some flops as well--the Bay of Pigs debacle for one.
 
 It's certainly unfortunate that JFK was assasinated, but it caused the country and history to sympathize with him and locked in a positive legacy for him. If you take his presidency based on accomplishments alone and what he did and didn't do, it wasn't anything exemplary, IMO.
